sentence.text: The index patient is presently a 19-year-old female born to healthy non-consanguineous Finnish parents from an uncomplicated pregnancy at term measuring 47.5 cm and 3450 g.
Early growth and development were normal; at 2 years height Z-score was −1.3.
Her hair was thin and sparse and nails were thin and brittle.
She suffered from recurrent otitis media and underwent tympanostomy 11 times.
Asthma was diagnosed at 3 years and treated with inhaled corticosteroids until age 7.
She had no pneumonias or invasive infections but frequent upper respiratory tract infections (URTIs).
Her immunoglobulin levels, complete blood counts and lymphocyte subclasses were repeatedly normal.
Pulmonary high-resolution computed tomography (HRCT) at 16 years showed no abnormalities.
Skeletal survey at 8 years was regarded normal (Figure 1).
Her height Z-score was at or above −2.0 until 12.5 years when she measured 140.4 cm (Figure 2).
Severe obesity developed after age 7 years.
Pubertal growth spurt was subnormal and clinical features of a skeletal dysplasia became evident by 14 years when CHH was suspected.
RMRP mutation analysis revealed compound heterozygosity for g.70A>G mutation and a 10-nucleotide duplication at position −13 (TACTCTGTGA), confirming the diagnosis of CHH.
Parents were both heterozygous carriers of one of the mutations.
The patient's adult height is 144.5 cm (−3.5 SDS) and weight 105 kg (body mass index 50.3 kg/m2).
